item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Processor load (1 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculates as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (5 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculates as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: System Local Time
item.description: Checks the system local time. Checa a hora local do sistema.

item.name: System information
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME}: {#IFNAME} traffic is too high
trigger_prototype.description: INPUT or OUTPUT network traffic is above {$LINUX_NETWORK_TRAFFIC_TOO_HIGH}

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than 3% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free disk space is less than 7% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free inodes is less than 7% on volume {#FSNAME}

trigger.name: Disk I/O is overloaded on {HOSTNAME}
trigger.description: OS spends significant time waiting for I/O (input/output) operations. It could be indicator of performance issues with storage system.

trigger.name: Lack of free memory available on {HOSTNAME}
trigger.description: Lack of free memory available on the hostname, uses the tem vm.memory.size[pavailable] and checks if the last 2 (130 seconds as we read pavailable every 60s) values have average less of 10%

trigger.name: Lack of free swap space on {HOSTNAME}
trigger.description: It probably means that the systems requires more physical memory.

trigger.name: PROCESS ntpd is not running on {HOSTNAME}
trigger.description: Process ntpd is not running, please check. NTPd is important to keep server date/time up to date.

dependency.name: Zabbix agent on {HOST.NAME} is unreachable for 10 minutes

trigger.name: System Time not synconized in {HOSTNAME}
trigger.description: System Time not synconized in {HOSTNAME} Horrio incorreto em {HOSTNAME}

trigger.name: {HOSTNAME}: Processor load high
trigger.description: The load average is above the number of CPUs of the machine.
